An intern encrypted two secret messages, accidentally reusing a prime in their RSA keys. Recover the flag from this ciphertext: 3003817754813077244389761465675078562092393665816737309339105788194534369258402343068081650444266468529012279990116412280897685798360735274879040552264967

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6294458365077203151724740490402359317617418635885281524559197162559761192510322347562371619940692268149474142227751430356957687394775733298760134804153929, e=2406727307109935576895715570934936845695362824117148811241717501821185706355063484210074849211424451575526822704925704050948861345519912185601692057963087

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{z6nbb6qh}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3003817754813077244389761465675078562092393665816737309339105788194534369258402343068081650444266468529012279990116412280897685798360735274879040552264967
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6294458365077203151724740490402359317617418635885281524559197162559761192510322347562371619940692268149474142227751430356957687394775733298760134804153929, e=2406727307109935576895715570934936845695362824117148811241717501821185706355063484210074849211424451575526822704925704050948861345519912185601692057963087
